text: <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and TNF receptor expression
In non-SE induced animals of the saline-infused groups , <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> immunoreactivity was weakly detected in PC neurons ( data not shown ) .
In 12 hr-post SE animals of the saline-infused group , most of the activated microglia showed strong <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> immunoreactivity ( Figure 1A ) .
This expression pattern was maintained up to 1 week after SE .

In non-SE - induced animals of the saline-infused groups , <extra_id_0> TNFp55R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TNFp75R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> immunoreactivities were also weakly observed in astrocytes ( data not shown ) .
In 12 hr-post SE animals of the saline-infused group , <extra_id_0> TNFp55R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> immunoreactivity was observed in astrocytes ( Figure 1B ) .

Unlike <extra_id_0> TNFp55R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> TNFp75R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> immunoreactivity was detected in endothelial cells as well as astrocytes ( Figures 1C-E ) .

One day to 1 week after SE , both <extra_id_0> TNFp55R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TNFp75R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> immunoreactivities were significantly reduced in astrocytes , not in endothelial cells , due to massive astroglial loss ( data not shown ) [ 5 , 7 , 8 , 20 ] .
